title: Sporting a brand new ethernet cable, I queue up with excitment and expectations.
body: And my packet loss is literally so much worse than it when I was on wifi. I have absolutely no idea what to do but to drop my router from a cliff. There isn't even a significant reduction in MS as well. What am I doing wrong? I felt like I tried everything that I can. I capped my FPS to prevent image instability, I play the game with 0 internet tabs open and I just... I just don't know what to do. Why is my internet so bad? I can't just say that the providers in Israel can't provide good internet at all because despite this fact being... a fact, I can't do anything to change it.

replies.body:
Having a fresh Ethernet is great as is a wired connection, but something else might be causing your in-game delays.  FPS issues are more driver or game render issues, and I'm thinking this is a connection problem based on the info you provided.  You can run a [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader) to be sure!

My suggestion for your specific issue is to go through our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide.  This will help tune up your connection and settings now that you are on a wired connection.  Let me know if you have any questions!

The only time I had an FPS drop was some problem that originated within a new patch. It's already gone for good, the only time my FPS gets even close to 60 is when I fight the Elder Drake. He takes a lot of FPS from me when he starts attacking. But FPS was never an issue since I got a new computer, it's all net... As far as I know\believe (?)

EDIT : I am trying to forward my ports but it's not working. I don't have the router that is used in the demonstrating video and therefore I have no idea how to do it. What is Riot's service name in d-link vdsl? I can't seem to find anything. It says invalid key session when I try to apply the settings. What am I doing wrong?

Here is an SS to clarify my situation, please help. http://prntscr.com/ei00n5

EDIT 2: I successfully went through every single solution that was listed in the article except for port forwarding. Tested in practice tool, seems good but I still want to get port forwarding done with in order to make sure everything is good to go.

Switch back to WIFI to test if it was a coincidence, anomaly, or due to the new patch.

If switching to WIFI alleviates the problem check your firewall settings on your computer and your router's settings.
There's something going on with this patch for me as well :(
